DataElement.preferredName: Non-Target Lesion RECIST Overall Response Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The overall response status for non-target lesions at a particular time, using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECISTv1.1).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Non-Target Lesion Identification Overall Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention._An assessment of the overall response of the disease to the therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredDefinition: The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention.:An assessment of the overall response of the disease to the therapy.

Concepts.definition: The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention.
An assessment of the overall response of the disease to the therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDISC aligned NCI CRF standards task. mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)_The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention._Including everything._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)

Concepts.definition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Leaving no doubt; not open to question.: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: Leaving no doubt; not open to question.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not all target lesions were assessed. Or not all non-target lesions were assessed.

Concepts.definition: Not all target lesions were assessed. Or not all non-target lesions were assessed.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated Long Name and Definition to match current NCIt. mc 4/27/2020

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueDomain.origin: RECISTv1.1:Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v1.1
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/26/18 jk VD created for overall summary response of non-target lesions (Tables 1 and 2) in RECISTv1.1 guidelines.

ReferenceDocuments.name: RECIST Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: CDE captures the overall response of all Non-target lesions. Use CDISC aligned CDE 6941947 to collect individual non-target lesion responses (log line). This CDE maps to RECISTv1.1 guideline summary Table 1, "Non-target lesions" column when target lesion is present AND Table 2, "Non-target lesions" column, when patients have non-target disease only.

ReferenceDocuments.name: iRECIST- 2017
ReferenceDocuments.description: iRECIST: guidelines for response criteria for use in trials testing immunotherapeutics
